name: Heart Lamp Interactive Workshop
description:
Some books stay with you long after you’ve turned the last page. Heart Lamp, the International Booker Prize–winning anthology by Banu Mushtaq, is one of those rare works. It makes you think and it makes you feel—drawing you into the lived experiences of Indian Muslim women, while also inviting you to reflect on your own world.
This October, we’re bringing Heart Lamp off the page and into our lives with an interactive workshop on the idea of freedom at our Indiranagar store. 
But this isn’t your usual book discussion. Instead, we’ll explore three of the anthology’s most powerful stories through music, art, and storytelling. It’s a chance to step away from screens, share perspectives, and spend a Sunday morning in meaningful conversation with fellow readers. No prior prep is needed—just pick up your copy of Heart Lamp at Champaca before the workshop.

name: The Art Of Flight
description:
In this 90-minute deep dive into arm balances, we’ll move beyond the surface and into the strength, structure, and spirit of the poses that make us feel like we're flying.

We’ll begin by warming up the body with targeted strength and mobility drills to activate the core, wrists, and shoulders. This lays the foundation for safe and sustainable arm balancing.
From there, we’ll explore essential alignment principles that demystify key transitions and make these seemingly impossible shapes, more accessible.
Through clear breakdowns and playful experimentation, you’ll learn how to “take off” with confidence—whether you’re working on Crow, Side Crow, Hustler’s or Peacock pose.
We’ll also cover how to fall safely, so fear doesn’t hold you back, and give space for mindful repetition, skill refinement, and personal breakthroughs.
Expect a blend of technique, mindset coaching, and drills, all aimed at helping you tap into your inner strength and elevate your practice.

Whether you're just starting to hover or need refining in arm balances; this is a safe space for you to practice and learn.

name: NOT-SO-KLASSIC (Veg)
description:
At Klaa, we’re always celebrating the roots but sometimes, we like to bend the rules.
Not So Klassic is our playful new series where we reimagine Goan flavours through a different lens: layered, experimental, and just a little bit cheeky.

Think familiar ingredients doing unfamiliar things, flavours that surprise you, and plates that tell a new kind of story. Each menu is a limited-edition tasting experience paired with thoughtfully chosen wines to match the mood.

This isn’t your typical Goan thali.
It’s Not So Klassic and we hope you’re as excited to taste it as we are to cook it.

name: NOT-SO-KLASSIC (Non-veg)
description:
At Klaa, we’re always celebrating the roots but sometimes, we like to bend the rules.
Not So Klassic is our playful new series where we reimagine Goan flavours through a different lens: layered, experimental, and just a little bit cheeky.

name: Sisters & Misters Salsa Workshop
description:
Salsa – Beginner Workshop

Always wanted to try Salsa but didn’t know where to start? This workshop is the perfect first step!

Join us for a fun session for beginners - no prior dance experience required.

We’ll guide you through the basics in a relaxed, playful way so you can feel the music, move with confidence, and discover just how fun and easy Salsa really is.

What to Expect:
1. Easy-to-follow salsa steps 
2. Partner rotations so you meet & dance with everyone
3. Interactive games to learn rhythm & movement

Perfect for:
    •    Total beginners (no dance background needed)
    •    Anyone looking to try something new & exciting
    •    People who love music, movement, and good vibes!

Dress code:

1. Wear whatever makes you feel your best and most comfortable - should be easy for you to move around. 
2. ⁠Carry a pair of socks with you - it’ll help with the dancing. You won’t be needing any special footwear for the session.

name: The Analog Club
description:
Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.

Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling.

Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!

Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones).

We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.

Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age!


Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter.

location.name: The studio by copper and cloves
location.address: The studio by copper and cloves, Bangalore

name: Pint of View (Lecture 6) - Deja Oops: Why Neuroscience Says Your Memory Can’t Be Trusted
description:
Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.

In our sixth lecture, we’re bringing you Dr. Sumyuktha Anand, a neuroscientist and science communicator who calls herself a neuroscience nerd. She has explored everything from addiction and reward circuits to the neuroscience of brain tumors, and while she earned her Ph.D. in Molecular and Cellular Biology, what excites her most is stepping outside the lab to share just how fascinating our brains really are. Passionate about making science accessible, Sumyuktha brings the marvels of neuroscience to non-specialist communities and now, to you — over a pint.

Her talk, Déjà Oops: Why Neuroscience Says Your Memory Can’t Be Trusted, dives into the quirks of memory and the science of neuroplasticity. We like to think of memory as a reliable archive, but the truth is it’s constantly being rewritten, distorted, and reinvented by our brains. Why does this happen? What does it say about how our brains work? And how does this “unreliability” help us more than it harms us?

Come, find out, and bring your questions — from everyday forgetfulness to the bigger mysteries of how memory shapes identity.

All of this, over Geist beer on tap at Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar! 🍻

What to Expect:

A 60-minute lecture on memory, neuroplasticity, and why our brains misremember
15-20 minutes of interactive Q&A
One Geist beer on tap or a mocktail included with your ticket
A lively mixer to share your insights, laugh over your “oops” moments, and walk away seeing your memory in a whole new way

About the Lecturer

Dr. Sumyuktha Anand is a neuroscientist and science communicator who has researched topics ranging from addiction and reward circuits to brain tumors. With a Ph.D. in Molecular and Cellular Biology, she is passionate about making brain science fun and accessible beyond academic circles — through teaching, writing, and now, with Pint of View.

About Pint of View

Inspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., Pint of View brings this format to India for the first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand while walking out with a new way of seeing the world.

Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

name: Pretzel Making Workshop
description:
Pretzel folding...
The event will flow in the following manner:

* Brief introduction on pretzel
* Chef demonstrating the folding procedure
* Guest replicating the demonstration
* Pretzels going for baking
* Guests given warm pretzels.

All SIS members are eligible for a 10% discount on any purchase at the cafe

name: Supper Clubs of India: Sweet Talk with Sakaré
description:
Bengaluru Servd and NIC Ice Creams present: Supper Clubs of India - Bengaluru Edition, a series of intimate dining experiences highlighting regional community-style meals and cuisines from across India!

Chef Jenny Clinta, founder of one of Bengaluru’s favourite Supper Clubs, Sakaré, is bringing us a pastry-lover’s feast!

Started in 2024, Sakaré was a way to showcase Chef Jenny’s journey from the Andamans to France where she trained to become a professional pastry chef.
For our Supper Club, she’s bringing back her iconic Gajar ka Halwa, her personal favourite- the Tiramisu, her famous Macarons, Apple Tarte Tatin, and many more dishes.

DISCLAIMER: All dishes contain egg.

The 7-course tasting menu starts with savouries followed by a palate cleanser as well as two indulgent dishes paired with surprise NIC Ice Creams flavours and petit fours to end the experience.
The entire supper is crafted to be perfectly-balanced in its sweetness with ingredients from the Andamans as well such as locally-sourced Pandan and Cinnamon!

Check out the Menu:


Also enjoy curated cocktails as you dive into the meal.

NOTE: Once tickets are booked, please share your meal preference (Eggetarian or Non-Vegetarian) along with any allergies with us on WhatsApp at 8123265307

Join us on Saturday, 11th October at Daysie, MG Road.
Limited seats. Book yours now!

name: Book Discussion of Broken Nest and Other Stories
description: Some stories are timeless, returning to us with new meanings each time they are retold. Broken Nest and Other Stories, translated by acclaimed poet Sharmistha Mohanty, brings Rabindranath Tagore’s unforgettable tales into a contemporary voice that resonates with today’s readers. At this special discussion, poet and translator Sharmistha Mohanty will be in conversation with writer and scholar Mani Rao, exploring how translation can revive, reframe, and reimagine Tagore’s narratives for new generations.

name: Bars From Far
description:
A cocktail festival that brings 9 of the best bars and bartenders from India, under one roof. Bars From Far by Greater Than Gin is back in Bangalore for its second edition.

What can you expect? Great cocktails, food pop-ups, and a fantastic music lineup featuring electronic, disco, afro, and house genres.

Experience a selection of the best bars from Goa, Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Jaipur and Chandigarh, alongside Nao Spirits’ very own MTW Bar and Toasties.

BFF is where you'll find the best bartenders stirring up the best cocktails by some of the best bars from across the country, but without leaving your city.

It's a bar crawl, but without the crawl. So mark your calendars and bring your BFF along to our BFF!

name: Bars From Far
description:

It's a bar crawl, but without the crawl. So mark your calendars and bring your BFF along to our BFF!

name: Kabir: A Dance Production of Timeless Tradition
description: How do centuries-old verses find new life in rhythm and movement? KABIR is a Bharatanatyam production that brings the timeless poetry of Sant Kabir into conversation with dance. What makes this work unique is the seamless weaving of Kabir’s Hindi verses into the expressive framework of Bharatanatyam, guided by the musical brilliance of Vidwan O. S. Arun. His evocative vocals create a living bridge between word and movement, allowing the spiritual depth of Kabir’s poetry to bloom on stage. Conceived and choreographed by Varsha Akhouri, alumna and former faculty of the Kalakshetra Foundation, the production embodies both tradition and innovation. With her students carrying forward the performance, the piece becomes not just a retelling of Kabir’s verses but a passing on of artistic legacy. Kabir’s words question dogma, transcend boundaries, and call us to simplicity, love, and self-realisation. In this production, poetry and dance converge to reveal their continued resonance with our fragmented world. A performance for the divine within and without. Credits: Music and Vocals: O S Arun, Concept and Choreography: Varsha Akhouri, Tabla: Martin, Mridangam: Shivaprasad, Sitar: Kishore, Flute: Hariprasad, Sound engineer: Rakesh, Jathi: Sheejith Krishna, Lights: Venkatesh Krishna. Dancers: Asika Sajeevan, Aarathi S Nair, Devika AC, Jisma K.K, Roopesh PP, Shobhit Shivhare, Sreelakshmi EB, Sreeshna KM, Sreerejini NS. Performer Varsha Akhouri, an accomplished Bharatanatyam exponent, is a dynamic artist whose journey in dance embodies a seamless blend of tradition and innovation. An alumna and former faculty member of the Kalakshetra Foundation, her artistry reflects the depth of her training and the authenticity of her craft. Being the founder and director of ‘Srishti’, Varsha Akhouri has dedicated herself to nurturing the next generation of dancers, fostering creativity while staying rooted in the classical ethos. Her performances are marked by profound storytelling, precise technique, and an innate ability to connect deeply with the audience. As a celebrated soloist, she has graced numerous esteemed platforms. Varsha’s artistic repertoire is enriched by her passion for exploring spiritual and philosophical themes, as seen in her current project on the mystic poet ‘Kabir’, featuring the soul-stirring music of Vidwan Sri O. S. Arun.

name: Court to Collector
description: A rare archive of Indian miniature painting folios from the Virji family. This exhibition and sale showcases a curated treasury of miniature painting folios collected by the Virji family over decades, as they travelled the globe in pursuit of rare folios steeped in heritage. Step into the intricate worlds of India’s past — where royal court life, mythology, and historical moments are preserved in delicate strokes and lush detail. Show Dates: September 22nd - November 30th, 2025. 10 am - 6 pm Venue: Mezzanine Floor, Gallery G

name: 5 Origins, 5 Methods – Brew your own Coffee
description: Explore the world of coffee like never before! From rich single origins to diverse brewing techniques, this all‑day interactive session is designed to let you discover, experiment, and taste coffee in your own way. With guidance from Something’s Brewing, you’ll have the chance to brew using multiple methods — espresso, manual brewers, and grinders — while sampling coffees from five unique origins. Whether you’re just starting your coffee journey or looking to deepen your appreciation for different brews, this event is your chance to learn, taste, and enjoy. In this session, you’ll: Explore five distinct coffee origins and their unique flavor profiles Try out five brewing methods, from espresso to manual brewing styles Brew your own coffee using the method of your choice Taste and compare different brews with fellow coffee lovers Learn how equipment like grinders and brewers influence the cup Conducted by: Something’s Brewing Who is this for? Coffee enthusiasts curious to brew their own cup Espresso and manual brewing fans Beginners looking to experiment with different brewing styles Anyone excited to taste and compare coffees from multiple origins Language: English, Hinglish Duration: 8 Hours

name: Hot Wednesday ft. DJ Ivan
description: Hot Wednesday at Happy Brew Bar & Kitchen brings the legendary DJ Ivan to the decks for a night of high-energy techno and melodic house. Known as one of India’s pioneers of electronic music, Ivan sets the dance floor ablaze with fiery beats and seamless mixes that keep the crowd moving till late. This midweek party promises a power-packed vibe with drinks flowing, curated bites, and a buzzing crowd ready to turn Wednesday into the highlight of the week. If you’re looking to shake off the routine and lose yourself to great music, this one’s not to be missed.

location.name: Happy Brew Bar & Kitchen, Koramangala
location.address: Happy Brew Bar & Kitchen, Koramangala, Bangalore

name: Horror Month at BFF - Titane
description:
Titane (2021)

By Julia Ducournau / 104' / French with Eng subs

Following a series of unexplained crimes, a father is reunited with the son who has been missing for 10 years. Titane : A metal highly resistant to heat and corrosion, with high tensile strength alloys. 

Julia Ducournau’s Palme d’Or-winner is a jaw-dropping blast of Cronenbergian Body Horror. Conceptually audacious and dripping with insouciant attitude, Titane ignites a Molotov cocktail of gender politics, familial compassion, and female desire.
